intro: Knautia heterotricha, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Knautia heterotricha is often found in mountain meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
